Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $p,$ $q,$ and $r$ be real numbers such that
\[ egin{vmatrix} p & b & c \ a & q & c \ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]Assuming that $a 
eq p,$ $b 
eq q,$ and $c 
eq r,$ find the value of $ rac{p}{p - a} +  rac{q}{q - b} +  rac{r}{r - c}.$
inference:
Solution:
Since the determinant is zero, we have
\[\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = p(qr - bc) - b(aq - ac) + c(ab - ap) = 0.\]Dividing both sides by $abc,$ we get
\[\frac{p}{c} - \frac{b}{a} + \frac{r}{b} - \frac{q}{a} + \frac{p}{b} - \frac{a}{c} = 0.\]Rearranging, we get
\[\frac{p}{c} + \frac{p}{b} - \frac{a}{c} - \frac{q}{a} - \frac{b}{a} + \frac{r}{b} = 0.\]Combining like terms, we get
\[\frac{p}{c} + \frac{p}{b} - \frac{a}{c} - \frac{q}{a} - \frac{b}{a} + \frac{r}{b} = 0.\]Multiplying both sides by $abc,$ we get
\[abc\left(\frac{p}{c} + \frac{p}{b} - \frac{a}{c} - \frac{q}{a} - \frac{b}{a} + \frac{r}{b}\right) = 0.\]Simplifying, we get
\[abp + acp - a^2 - bqc - b^2 + arc = 0.\]Factoring, we get
\[(ab - a^2) + (ac - b^2) + (acp - bqc + arc) = 0.\]Simplifying, we get
\[a(b - a) + c(a - b) + c(ap - bq + ar) = 0.\]Dividing both sides by $c,$ we get
\[a(b - a) + c(a - b) + ap - bq + ar = 0.\]Rearranging, we get
\[ap - bq + ar = c(b - a) - a(b - a).\]Simplifying, we get
\[ap - bq + ar = c(b - a) - a(b - a).\]Dividing both sides by $a(b - a),$ we get
\[\frac{p}{b - a} - \frac{q}{a - b} + \frac{r}{a - c} = \frac{c}{a - b} - 1.\]Adding $1$ to both sides, we get
\[\frac{p}{b - a} - \frac{q}{a - b} + \frac{r}{a - c} + 1 = \frac{c}{a - b}.\]Multiplying both sides by $a - b,$ we get
\[(a - b)\left(\frac{p}{b - a} - \frac{q}{a - b} + \frac{r}{a - c} + 1\right) = c.\]Simplifying, we get
\[p - q + r + a - b = c.\]Rearranging, we get
\[p + r + a - b - q = c.\]Dividing both sides by $c,$ we get
\[\frac{p}{c} + \frac{r}{c} + \frac{a}{c} - \frac{b}{c} - \frac{q}{c} = 1.\]Multiplying both sides by $abc,$ we get
\[abc\left(\frac{p}{c} + \frac{r}{c} + \frac{a}{c} - \frac{b}{c} - \frac{q}{c}\right) = abc.\]Simplifying, we get
\[abp + acr + a^2 - b^2 - bqc = abc.\]Factoring, we get
\[(ab - a^2) + (ac - b^2) + (acr - bqc) = abc - abc.\]Simplifying, we get
\[a(b - a) + c(a - b) + c(ar - bq) = 0.\]Dividing both sides by $c,$ we get
\[a(b - a) + c(a - b) + ar - bq = 0.\]Rearranging, we get
\[ar - bq = c(b - a) - a(b - a).\]Simplifying, we get
\[ar - bq = c(b - a) - a(b - a).\]Dividing both sides by $a(b - a),
ground_truth:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}

ground_truth:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}
